levelledPara.title: NAME
levelledPara.para: s1kd-validate - Validate an S1000D data module against its schema

levelledPara.title: DESCRIPTION
levelledPara.para: The s1kd-validate tool validates an S1000D data module, checking whether it is a valid XML file and if it is valid against its own S1000D schema.

listItemDefinition.para: Search for schemas in <dir>. Normally, the URI of the schema is used to fetch it locally or over a network, but this option will force searching to be performed only in the specified directory.
This can also be accomplished through the use of XML catalogs.
Set the verbosity of the output, verbose, quiet, and debug. Verbose will explictly indicate success, rather than simply not displaying any errors. Quiet will not output anything.
Exclude an XML namespace from the validation. Elements in the namespace specified by <URI> are ignored.
Any number of data modules to validate. If none are specified, input is read from stdin.

levelledPara.title: Multi-spec directory with -d option
levelledPara.para: The -d option can point either to a directory containing the XSD schema files for a single S1000D spec (i.e. the last part of the schema URI), or to a directory containing schemas for multiple specs. The latter must follow a particular format for the tool to locate the appropriate schemas for a given spec:

para.verbatimText: schemas/ <-- The directory passed to -d S1000D_4-1/ xml_schema_flat/ [4.1 XSD files...] S1000D_4-2/ xml_schema_flat/ [4.2 XSD files...]

levelledPara.title: XML catalogs vs. -d option
levelledPara.para: XML catalogs provide a more standard method of redirecting public, network-based resources to local copies. As part of using libxml2, there are several locations and environment variables from which this tool will load catalogs.
